In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input, ' ')
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width && !isempty(result)
            result *= "\n"
        end
        
        result *= "$word "
    end

    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
print(wrap_string("This is an example of wrapping a string", text_width=12))
```

This will produce the following output:

```plaintext
This is 
an example 
of wrapping 
a string
```
